page.title: 09Landscape and Buildings
page.content: The farmland is mainly used for grazing but some crops such as potato and barley are harvested. 7 farms are in ths area plus a piggery and an Animal By-Products factory. The land is undulating with the higher points to the N. up to 105m. The largest land reclamation scheme in Britain is transforming 10.36 sq.km of derelict land into Lochore Meadows Country Park. 200,000 young trees have been planted. More tree-planting has been done on the road to Glengraig. A fine 3-dial clock sits above the Co-op. shop in Bank St. Lochgelly. It was made by J.Smith & Sons, Derby; erected in 1910; it chimes every quarter and half hour; it is maintained by the local Co-op. jeweller.
